48  class ROSserver : public QThread {
49  // Q_OBJECT macro should not be needed (no connect call)
50 
52  bool ROSrun; // solution 2
53 
55  bool empty_workspace;
56 
58  void run() { // no exec() call = no event handling
59  // seperate the terminal command from what it should start
60  const QString termCmd("xterm -e %1"),
61  workspace(empty_workspace ? "qt_ctrl void" :
62  "turtlebot_gazebo turtlebot"),
63  ROScmd("roslaunch %1_world.launch");;
64  QProcess ROSprocess;
65  ROSprocess.start( termCmd.arg( ROScmd.arg(workspace) ) );
66  //exec(); // solution 1, does not stop ROSprocess
67  while (ROSrun); // wait for a ROSserver::stop() (sol. 2)
68  ROSprocess.close(); // OK with solution 2
69  } // end of void run()
70 
71  public:
74  ROSserver(QObject* parent) : QThread(parent), ROSrun(true) {}
75 
80  void setEmptyWorkspace(const bool& empty)
81  { empty_workspace = empty; }
82 
87  void sleep(const long& seconds) const { QThread::sleep(seconds); }
88 
90  void stop() {
91  ROSrun = false; // ask to the run() method to stop (sol. 2)
92  quit(); wait(); // when stopped, stop the thread
93  } // end of void stop()
94 
95  }; // end of class ROSserveur

163  void connectCtrl() {
164  connect( controller, SIGNAL( stateUpdated(const State&) ),
165  this, SLOT( updateState(const State&) ) );

167  SIGNAL( commandsUpdated(const double&, const double&) ),

169  ) );
170  }

172  // @brief Asks in a dialog for a set of doubles, and returns it.
173  // @param nb_lines the number of lines in the dialog,
174  // @param nb_col the number of columns in the dialog,
175  // @param nameVal the array of names displayed,
176  // @param isGreek the array indicating wether name is in Greek,
177  // @param val the array of doubles to get from the user.
178  // @pre the arrays need to have at least nb_lines x nb_col
179  // elements, or a segmentation violation may arrise.
181  void getDoubleArray(const int nb_lines, const int nb_col,
182  const char* nameVal[],
183  const bool isGreek[], double val[]);

198  // Freeing the Qt widget pointer is OK, the other one generates
199  // a segmentation fault (?!?).
200  ~QtCtrlGUI() { if ( ROS_server.isRunning() ) ROS_server.stop();
201  delete ctrl_wdgt; /* delete controller; */ }

204  const MotionModel& motionModel() const { return motion_model; }

215  void closeEvent(QCloseEvent* event) {
216  if ( ctrl_node.connected() )
217  // simplified version of buttonStartStop()
218  { ctrl_node.end(); ROS_server.stop(); }
219  writeSettings(); QMainWindow::closeEvent(event);
220  qApp->closeAllWindows();
221  }
